etymology.description: semantic 米(米) (mǐ, "rice") + phonetic 且(且) (qiě, "further") = rice in abundance or coarseness -> coarse; rough
etymology.interpretation: The character 粗(cū) combines 米(米) (mǐ, "rice") suggesting a grainy texture with 且(且) (qiě, "further") as the phonetic element, together implying something that is not finely processed, hence the meaning 'coarse; rough'.

examples.chinese: 这块石头表面粗(這塊石頭表面粗)。
examples.english: The surface of this stone is coarse.

examples.chinese: 他的表达方式粗(他的表達方式粗)，让人难以接受(讓人難以接受)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de biǎodá fāngshì cū, ràng rén nányǐ jiēshòu.
examples.english: His way of expression is coarse, making it hard for people to accept.

examples.chinese: 这根绳子编织得很粗(這根繩子編織得很粗)，但却十分结实(但卻十分結實)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè gēn shéngzi biānzhī de hěn cū, dàn què shífēn jiéshí.
examples.english: This rope is woven roughly, yet it is very sturdy.
